isis.stitle: 7.3 Liter Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1991) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES FOR 7.3 LITER DIESEL ENGINES - EXHAUST BACK PRESSURE TEST

svcproc.title: EXHAUST BACK PRESSURE TEST
svcproc.para: If excessive exhaust back pressure is suspected, proceed as follows:

note.para: Measure back pressure at each exhaust manifold.

step1.para: Drill and braze a 1/8 in. NPT male connector to the exhaust pipe approximately 3 in. below the exhaust manifold flange.
Connect a minimum of one foot coiled copper tubing to the connector before attaching the plastic tubing from the Model 200 Pressure Test Kit (ZTSE-2239).

note.para: The coiled copper tubing prevents the plastic tubing from melting.

step1.para: Connect the other end of the plastic tubing to the magnahelic gauge on the Model 200 Pressure Test Kit or a water manometer.
Obtain the data at full load and rated speed on a chassis dynamometer or on the highway. The engine must be at normal operating temperature.
Back pressure, as indicated in the "Performance Data Guidelines" in this section, should not exceed 40 in. H2O.
Pressures which exceed the guidelines indicate a restriction. Reduce restriction by replacing the muffler or exhaust piping as required.
